message_1:
Determine whether the following knots are equivalent or not:

Knot 1: 

![Knot 1](https://i.imgur.com/wGYNJd9.png)

Knot 2: 

![Knot 2](https://i.imgur.com/8BpsWzg.png)

Hint: Consider the number of crossings and how the strands pass through each other to determine if the knots can be transformed into each other without cutting or joining any strands.
message_2:
To determine if the knots are equivalent, we will analyze the number of crossings and the way the strands pass through each other.

Knot 1:
- There are 6 crossings.
- The crossings alternate between over and under as we follow the strand.

Knot 2:
- There are 6 crossings.
- The crossings also alternate between over and under as we follow the strand.

Since both knots have the same number of crossings and the strands pass through each other in the same alternating pattern, we can conclude that the knots are equivalent. They can be transformed into each other without cutting or joining any strands.
